title: Apply to our program for startups using AI to improve U.S. infrastructure.
description: Today, we’re opening applications for our second Google for Startups AI Academy: American Infrastructure cohort.This six-month program provides tailored technical suppor…
author: Lisa GevelberVPGoogle for Startups
excerpt: Today, we’re opening applications for our second Google for Startups AI Academy: American Infrastructure cohort.This six-month program provides tailored technical support and mentorship for Seed to Series A startups using AI in critical industries such as (but not limited to):AgricultureDisaster prevention and responseEnergyEducationHealthcarePublic safetySmart manufacturing and logisticsTelecommunicationsTransportationUrban developmentWater managementWorkforce development and economic opportunityAlongside a community of inspiring founders and program alumni, you’ll engage in workshops focused on AI/ML best practices, product strategy, executive-level leadership coaching, sales and marketing training and more. While the majority of the program will take place virtually, founders will also have the opportunity to connect during an in-person summit.If you're building an AI-driven solution for infrastructure challenges in the U.S., we want to work with you. Learn more and apply on our website by May 13, 2025.

While the majority of the program will take place virtually, founders will also have the opportunity to connect during an in-person summit.If you're building an AI-driven solution for infrastructure challenges in the U.S., we want to work with you. html:
Today, we’re opening applications for our second Google for Startups AI Academy: American Infrastructure cohort.

This six-month program provides tailored technical support and mentorship for Seed to Series A startups using AI in critical industries such as (but not limited to):

  • Agriculture
  • Disaster prevention and response
  • Energy
  • Education
  • Healthcare
  • Public safety
  • Smart manufacturing and logistics
  • Telecommunications
  • Transportation
  • Urban development
  • Water management
  • Workforce development and economic opportunity

Alongside a community of inspiring founders and program alumni, you’ll engage in workshops focused on AI/ML best practices, product strategy, executive-level leadership coaching, sales and marketing training and more. While the majority of the program will take place virtually, founders will also have the opportunity to connect during an in-person summit.

If you're building an AI-driven solution for infrastructure challenges in the U.S., we want to work with you. Learn more and apply on our website by May 13, 2025.
